newsitem.title: GREECE: BANK/GREECE TO HOLD FIXED RATE DEPO TENDER WEDNESDAY.
newsitem.headline: BANK/GREECE TO HOLD FIXED RATE DEPO TENDER WEDNESDAY.

text.p: Greece's central bank offered to drain an unspecified amount of 14-day funds at 11.90 percent via a fixed interest rate tender on Wednesday, it said in a statement.

"The Bank of Greece announces that on Wednesday 9 July 1997, it will accept deposits from banks through a fixed rate tender," it said. "The total amount will be set by the Bank of Greece after the submission of bids."
Payment date is July 9 and maturity value date is July 23, it said.
"In case of oversubscription, bids will be satisfied pro rata, with a minimum allotment of 500 million drachmas," it added.
Bids should be submitted by fax between 1130 local (0830 GMT) and 1230 (0930 GMT).
